author: Samuel Holland
message:
platform: sun50i: Fix r_i2c pins on H5

Since the H5 does not have an RSB controller, the I²C pinmux is on a
different function.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
drivers: irqchip: sun4i-intc: Fix receiving NMIs (IRQ 0)

As an optimization, the current code tries to handle all incoming IRQs
during a single interrupt. This has worked before because the current
IRQ register reads as zero when no IRQs are pending. However, the NMI
pin connected to the PMIC is at interrupt zero. In that case, the
register will read zero even though there is a pending interrupt.

Solve the issue by only handling one IRQ per interrupt.

author: Samuel Holland
message: drivers: Fix Kconfig for I²C and RSB\n\nSigned-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
drivers: sun6i-i2c: Fix GPIO pinmux on A83T

It looks like the H5 is the odd SoC, having R_I2C on pinmux 2. A83T,
A64, and H6 all have R_I2C on pinmux 3, even though H6 (like H5) does
not have RSB.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
debug: Allow COMPILE_TEST to fill the full address space

Removing the assertions only allows the allocation for the stack to run
past the end of SRAM A2. ld(1) produces an error if it has to allocate
an object outside the memory region we defined. So to remove *all* size
restrictions, the memory region must also be enlarged to the size of the
address space.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
debug: Fix dependencies on the PMIC debug monitor command

This command should only be enabled when the debug monitor itself is
enabled. This has no effect on the generated code, since the file is
otherwise not compiled, but it shows up in .config files.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
drivers: regmap: Provide I2C pin config via Kconfig

The logic for choosing the correct pin mode for PL0 and PL1 is more
complicated than will fit on a single line. The H3 is pin-compatible
with the H5, and it also requires a mode of 2. A more general rule is
that only chips with an RSB controller put I2C on mode 3 (which makes
sense, as RSB uses mode 2). Then H6 becomes the exception, not H5.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
drivers: sun6i-i2c: Silence warning with COMPILE_TEST

This driver is always compiled when COMPILE_TEST is enabled, even if
I2C_PINS_NONE is selected. In that case, *r_i2c.pins would have an empty
initializer, and this triggers -Wpedantic. Fix this by moving the
compound literal array inside the preprocessor conditions. Then when
I2C_PINS_NONE is selected, r_i2c.pins is a null pointer.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
Kconfig: Add a feature for platforms with UART4

Because HAVE_UART4 is selected by platforms, it cannot have any
dependencies, or Kconfig will throw a warning. However, currently the
entirety of drivers/serial/Kconfig is inside `if SERIAL`. To drop the
dependency, move the definition of SERIAL into drivers/serial/Kconfig.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>

author: Jernej Skrabec
message:
configs: Add Beelink GS1 defconfig

Beelink GS1 is TV box based on H6. It includes AXP805 PMIC but it has no
power button. It comes with remote, so scancode and protocol are adjusted.

Note: Although according to PCB images board seems to have external
32768 Hz oscillator, it doesn't work on most of them. Non-working OSC32k
caused strange problems with suspend like watchdog reboots. This issue
is fixed in DT by switching to internal 32k oscillator.

Signed-off-by: Jernej Skrabec <jernej.skrabec@siol.net>

author: Samuel Holland
message:
debug: Hide DEBUG_RECORD_STEPS on A83T

A83T does not have a built-in RTC, so this feature cannot be used on
that SoC. If enabled, it causes a build failure due to the missing
DEV_RTC definition.

Signed-off-by: Samuel Holland <samuel@sholland.org>
